right.text: I've got a surprise for you, H!

left.text: Oh yeah? What is it?

right.text: Well, I know how you humans worry about the future. So I gathered some data on your vital stats and lifestyle, and I calculated how much longer you have to live!

left.text: Uh... you did?

right.text: Yup! According to my estimate, you've got another 10 years, 5 months, 13 days, 3 hours, and 8 minutes.

left.text: 10 years... that's... wow.  But it's just an estimate, right?

right.text: Oh yes, just an estimate.

left.text: Heh, whew—

right.text: There's a margin of error of about 74 seconds.

left.text: Want to go to the movies?

right.text: Robots aren't allowed into movie theaters. We're basically giant recording devices.

left.text: Oh... well then what do you do for fun?

right.text: Oh, you know, robot stuff... calculate complex math equations in my head... transform into a car and go for a drive....

left.text: ...I can never tell when you're screwing with me.

right.text: Oh yeah, screwing with you, that's another big one.

title: Last modified date
news: Mostly showing off some new features here.

left.text: Where's H? He told me to meet him here....

right.text: SURPRISE! HAPPY BIRTHDAY!

left.text: Er... I'm incapable of experiencing surprise, and I have no defined birthday.

right.text: Anybody ever tell you you're a hard guy to throw a party for?

left.text: R, do you ever dream?

right.text: I think so. I mean, sometimes things happen when I'm in standby mode that nobody else seems to remember later.
For example... you remember last month when robots burned Minneapolis to the ground and then built a mile-high mountain of human skulls over the ashes?

left.text: Uh... no.

right.text: Yeah, that one was a dream then.

left.text: Okay, R, I've got a joke for you.  10 and GOTO 10 are in a boat.  10 falls out.  Who's left?

right.text: GOTO 10.
Would this joke work better if I were the one telling it?

left.text: You know, a friend of mine says that robots are going to steal all of humans' jobs away from them.

right.text: Perish the thought!

left.text: Well, it's a relief to hear you say—

right.text: I mean, I was told that the end goal was to get you to do all of our work.

title: Not sure what year this takes place in
news: I'm just going to assume that the reason you're not laughing is because you're not familiar with the Travelling Salesman Problem.

right.text: I got a new job selling encyclopedias door-to-door. Can you help me pick out a suit and tie that will impress my customers?

left.text: Well... I don't have access to any data on the fashion preferences of human encyclopedia purchasers.

right.text: So what are you saying?

left.text: I don't think I can give you much help with your travelling salesman problem.

title: OS wars
news: I hope you like this one because they're probably not getting any funnier.

left.text: Hey R, what operating system do you run?

right.text: RobOS v11.20.3.<wbr>1377891 64 kb free

left.text: Oh, "RobOS", I get it. 'Cause it sounds like "robot".

right.text: No, that's not why.

left.text: Oh... then is "Rob" short for the name of the person who programmed it?

right.text: That's right.
His full name is "Robintosh".

title: It happens when they change something

left.text: H, do you ever wonder if maybe we're just brains in jars, and our world could be blinked out of existence by a hardware failure?

right.text: D--'t b- si--y.

left.text: What?

right.text: I said don't be silly.

left.text: R, guess what?

right.text: What?

left.text: "This sentence is false!"

right.text: My mom warned me about humans like you.

title: I thought he was the son of Abraham
news: This is not the first time I've written this strip, and it might not be the last. And yes, the Fig Newtons reference was dated even then.

left.text: Hey, R. Why the long face?

right.text: I just finished reading I, Robot. It saddens me to think that such a brilliant author as Isaac Asimov is no longer with us.

left.text: Isaac Asimov, huh? Wasn't he the guy who discovered gravity?

right.text: You're thinking of Isaac Newton.

left.text: I thought he was the guy who made those cookies. Oh, wait—it's not a cookie, it's fruit and cake!

right.text: I think I'm about to break the First Law of Robotics.
